[[Image:East Bight.png|thumb|''The East Bight'' in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game]]'']]
The '''East Bight''' was a great indentation in the eastern edge of the south of [[Mirkwood]].

It was a clearing with roughly the shape of a square that stretched for approximately fifty miles from north to south and from east to west.<ref>{{UT|Map}}</ref> To the west of the East Bight lay the [[Narrows of the Forest]], the narrowest part of the forest where the forest was less than one hundred miles across.<ref>{{UT|8e}}, Note 13</ref>

The East Bight had mostly been created by the felling of trees by the [[Northmen]] and contained most of their permanent homes.<ref>{{UT|Northmen}}, p. 288</ref>

==Etymology==
[[Wayne G. Hammond|Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull|Scull]] have explained that the word ''[[Wiktionary:bight|bight]]'' (in this context) refers to "a curve or recess in a coastline or other geographical feature".<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. lxvii</ref>
